newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' SEC investigates market manipulators.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' SEC investigates market manipulators.

text.p: The Philippines' Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has launched an investigation into possible manipulation of the market during its recent plunge, SEC chairman Perfecto Yasay said on Tuesday.

"The SEC has initiated a discreet inquiry on whether or not certain market players may have schemed to create a panic reaction, or at least taken advantage of the situation for selfish motives, in violation of our laws and rules on full disclosure, market manipulation, and insider trading," Yasay said in a letter to President Fidel Ramos.
Yasay said the drop in the stock market, which in recent weeks has seen some of its sharpest falls in over two years, were not underpinned by serious economic flaws and failing corporate health.
"The so-called erratic behaviour in the stock market is a freak development. It does not dovetail with the overall economic and financial climate of the country," Yasay said.
"Our market reforms, now in place, are strong enough to correct this anomaly in due time," he added.
